text: A fishing line is a thin flexible string or line intended for angling. It can be made from any of a number of materials. Monofilament is the most common.Ron Garrison, The Everything Fishing Book: Grab Your Tackle Box and Get Hooked on America's Favorite Sport (Avon, MA: Adams Media, 2003.), p. 70 It is made from a single fiber of plastic. Fishing line is rated for its breaking strength, castability, and knot strength. Abrasion resistance is another good quality of a fishing line. == References == category:Fishing
title: Fishing line
